result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven W Margelofsky was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

:38 PM Court calls 21CM242, 22CM17 and 22CM51.  Defendant Steven W Margelofsky in court.  Attorney Michael Rudolph Bauer in court for Steven W Margelofsky.  Attorney Robert G. Barrington in court for State of Wisconsin. State is victim rights compliant.  Court questions defendant and reviews chgs and pens.  Defendant will enter a plea in Count 1 of 22CM17 - Count 2 will be DRI;  Counts 1 & 2 in 22CM51 will be DRI and Count 1 in 21CM242 will be a DPA.  Defendant enters NC plea in Count 1 of Case No 21CM242 and Count 1 in 22CM17 (without penalty enhancer).  Court accepts plea in 21CM242 but withholds finding of Guilt and approves DPA - in 22CM17 Court finds defendant Guilty w/o penalty enhancer.  Parties heard on arguments.  Defendant makes statement.  Court heard and imposes sentence as follows:

22CM17- Count 1
w/held sentence - 12 mos probation
COP - complete DPA
court costs
DNA sample

Court address' bail modification motion.  State does not oppose request to remove absolute sobriety clause. Court grants.

10:56 AM (22CM17/22CM51) Defendant, Steven W Margelofsky in court, Jin Ho D. Pack appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Court finds probable cause. Court enters Not Guilty plea. RD & JT set. Court sets $1000 CASH bond with conditions:  Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with victim;  Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.  Return date scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
